name: Ai2 SERA (Soft-verified Efficient Repository Agents)
description: Open-source AI coding agents that adapt to any private codebase. SERA-32B achieves 55% on SWE-Bench Verified, surpassing prior open-source models. Fully open source including models, code, and Claude Code integration. Costs ~$400 to reproduce on commodity hardware—100x cheaper than existing approaches.
community_quotes: Could change how software gets written
Open coding agents are getting real
26x more efficient than reinforcement learning approaches
Fast, accessible coding agents that adapt to any repo

name: GitHub Copilot Agentic Memory
description: Cross-agent memory system for GitHub Copilot that enables persistent repository-level memory across sessions. Agents retain knowledge about codebases and share learnings across development workflows. Available in public preview for all paid Copilot plans.
community_quotes: A new era of intelligent development
A significant milestone—moving past the era of previous limitations
Memory is an action, not a database
Adding memory could dramatically improve productivity by eliminating repeated context

name: Tonkotsu
description: GUI for managing a team of coding agents from a document interface. Provides clean, focused workflow orchestration for multiple AI coding agents with document-based workflow. Currently free during early access. Achieved #1 Product of the Day on Product Hunt with 313 upvotes.
community_quotes: Thanks for #1 - here's what's next (from makers)
Clean, focused GUI for managing AI agents
